Cs:go is a great start for anyone trying to get into fps because of its high skill ceiling and simple to understand mechanics, the economy system adds a layer of complexity that most games don't have and the active community makes the game enjoyable for hours.

Counter Strike Global Offensive is a gritty chinese tactical shooter loosely based on the events of the game BTD6 (Baloons tower defense 6), which itself aims to faithfully portray the events that took place in 1993 - 1995 in Bosnia during the breakup of yugoslavia and the wars it led to. The game was a mass hit in russia, which is one of the main reasons why you mostly get matched up with non bilingual russians (and also turkish people , but they can go fuck themselves). I feel like it's needless to say anything about the core gameplay  as you have probably hear that song and dance a billion times, so I would rather complain about the fact that ValvE employed the brightest minds of a generation and provided them with a blank check, to develop the world's cutting edge premier anti cheat service, so edgy it could cut the world in half and instead they took the money and decided to violently masturbate to chinese cartoons for the rest of their careers.

Overall 5.5/10
